intro: Glyciphylla hispidula, commonly known as the hairy glyciphylla, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its native habitat. Glyciphylla hispidula is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its resilience and ability to stabilize soil.
